speaker: Dungeon Master & NPCs
lines: Griffin McElroy

speaker: Magnus Burnsides
lines: Travis McElroy

speaker: Merle Highchurch
lines: Clint McElroy

speaker: Taako Taaco
lines: Justin McElroy

speaker: Episode 18 — Petals to the Metal — Part 1
Griffin
lines: Previously on The Adventure Zone…

speaker: The Director
lines: The seekers look out for any information that can aid in the finding of these relics, but they are forbidden from claiming them themselves. That’s where you come in, the Reclaimers, your job duties will just include following up on any promising information that our seekers and spies find for us. We will send you out on missions and you will do what you did in Phandalin… ideally without involving the destruction of an entire city and the loss of thousands of souls.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well… I mean, ideally, yeah…

speaker: Griffin
lines: The three of you can see in the sky, for— for just two seconds, the sky is filled with thousands of bright white eyes.

speaker: Clint
lines: Magnus immediately assumes he got a hold of some bad unicorn dick.

speaker: Announcer
lines: Come on in! Come to the place where fun never ends! Come on in, it’s time to party with… Garfield and Friends— IT’S THE ADVENTURE ZONE!

speaker: [THEME MUSIC
lines: “Déjà Vu” by Mort Garson (full song on YouTube)]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are you ready to start a new storyline? A new grand adventure.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yes, yes.

speaker: Clint
lines: A new chapter!

speaker: Travis
lines: Please, Griffin, please start. I’m so hungry for it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: In the… in the Blood— in the Blood Eagle saga. Which is what I’m calling this— this whole storyline, is the Blood Eagle saga.

speaker: Travis
lines: The Blood Eagle sausage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, this Blood Eagle sausage chapter begins right… now!

speaker: Travis
lines: [enthusiastic guitar solo sounds]

speaker: Griffin
lines: The three of you are fighting. You’re in a fight and you’re in—

speaker: Travis
lines: Like with each other? Like we’re in a disagreement? Like, “You drank my milk!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re in combat.

speaker: Clint
lines: Hitting the ground running!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, you are in the icosagon, the training dojo for the Bureau of Balance and you are squaring off, the three of you are fighting against a three-strong team of formidable combatants. You’re fighting against Killian, you’re fighting against Avi—

speaker: Clint
lines: And Mobius!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you’re fi— who?

speaker: Clint
lines: …I’m sorry.

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing] I think he meant to say Morpheus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Did you mean Morpheus?

speaker: Clint
lines: No, Mobius! As in the guy that invented the strip.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The Breathe Right strip.

speaker: Travis
lines: And the— and the fight is taking forever. [laughter]

speaker: Griffin
lines: The fight is going on for long time. You three are fighting against Avi, Killian, and Robbie. It’s a friendly sparring match—

speaker: Travis
lines: And then we killed Robbie.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, no, you can’t kill Robbie; I have big franchise plans for Robbie. But you are— you are doing some friendly sparring, you’re doing some training. Robbie is— is throwing some— some cocktails at you, Killian is doing some acrobatic evasion and— and firing off some dulled crossbow bolts your way. Avi seems like he’s holding back a little bit, maybe he’s too nice to actually do any damage, he’s too friendly to any friend— he’s too friendly to take an honest-to-god full-force swing at you.

speaker: Justin
lines: You drop us in the middle of the fight— I don’t know the stakes. Are there any babes that I’m trying to impress? [laughter]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, sorry, circling the— the ring there are dozens of Bureau of Balance employees that are there to see what these— these three reclaimers that have brought back two Grand Relics, they wanna know what these three people are capable of. And— so yeah, I guess there are a few women in the audience, Taako. If— if—

speaker: Justin
lines: But, okay, Griffin, there are women in the audience, but are there behbs?

speaker: Griffin
lines: There are no more than four— no less than four behbs, and— but no less than 16 belhbs.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, I know this one! And one of them has a birthday in May and only wears red hats—

speaker: Justin
lines: Somebody draw me a matrix.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay I’ve got this—

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing] Y’know, remember, The Matrix starring Mobius?

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, you just sat back and waited for that one didn’t ya? Just waited.

speaker: Justin
lines: Just waited. Step into my web!

speaker: Griffin
lines: The fight is interrupted before you can do anything impressive, by the voice of—

speaker: Travis
lines: But I was just about to. I want— Let the record show—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it sure sounds like it. The voice of the Director booms through the uh, the danger room, and, requests your presence in her office for an urgent matter. Killian says

speaker: Killian
lines: Aw man, I was just about to— to put the hurt on y’all. I was just about to— to use my limit break. Y’all don’t even know what I’m capable of.

speaker: Clint
lines: Wow.  S— she sounds like Holly Hunter.

speaker: Travis
lines: She sounds like Griffin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: …Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: She basically sounds like Griffin, yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean, she was the first voice— she was the first voice I ever did, so it was—

speaker: Travis
lines: Ditto, at this point are we lining up to high-five and say good game and stuff and?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh yeah, yeah. It’s all very, very cordial. There’s a special Bureau of Balance handshake that you do, and it’s basically the handshake, the secret handshakes shake from Big. That’s sort of the— the greeting for members of your order.

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughing] So when we show up a half hour later to the Director’s office she’s like, “What were you guys doing? Was it the handshake again? Ugh!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: “Ugh! Thank you for coming to my—” she says— “thank you for coming to my office. Shimmy, shimmy cocoa puff” and does the whole thing. [Travis giggling in the background]

speaker: Justin
lines: So— should we go to her, like, office, or whatever…?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah you’re there.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Woah! Oh, hey.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She is speaking to Davenport, hold— going through some papers when you enter into her— her office, and looks up at you with a start as you enter into her room, and she stands tall with her— her white oak staff and addresses you and says

speaker: The Director
lines: I have an urgent mission for you. You’ll need to depart posthaste—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, hi. Hello?

speaker: The Director
lines: Oh, sorry. Hey. Shimmy, shimmy cocoa puff, listen to me now— wait, no that’s Country Grammar…

speaker: Merle
lines: How ya doin’?

speaker: The Director
lines: I’m doing just fine. Uh.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Say hello to my fish.

speaker: The Director
lines: You want me to—

speaker: Merle
lines: That’s Steven.

speaker: The Director
lines: You want me to addr— Oh, look at that. Yes, well, I see you’ve got a little friend there. Does he do anything?

speaker: Magnus
lines: He swims around in his tiny ball. And he loves me.

speaker: Merle
lines: And right now he’s doing his trick of swimming upside down on the surface of the water.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Steven is not dead! Steven is eternal.

speaker: Merle
lines: He’s in a sphere! He’s not in a fishbowl. How do you feed him? How do you—

speaker: Magnus
lines: [talking over] Steven is eternal!

speaker: Merle
lines: Aaahhhh.

speaker: The Director
lines: If you’re quite done, I have a job for the three of you. It should be quite, uh, much easier than your last job, although your last job entailed you literally going to a train station and getting a thing out of a box…

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, there was a little bit more to it than that.

speaker: Travis
lines: I just remembered to do my Magnus voice.

speaker: The Director
lines: Terrific. I have a job for you. I need the three of you to report to the city of Goldcliff.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Mhm.

speaker: The Director
lines: Certainly you’ve been? Certainly you’re familiar with Goldcliff?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Very.

speaker: Taako
lines: We actually have only been to three places—

speaker: Merle
lines: And they’re no longer there.

speaker: Taako
lines: … And most of them aren’t there anymore. [laughter]

speaker: The Director
lines: Goldcliff, certainly you’ve heard of… It is the financial seat of power in all of the realm. It’s w— it’s where the money lives.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Of course.

speaker: The Director
lines: There’s a Grand Relic one of our seekers have found in the city of Goldcliff, and it is in the possession of a master criminal known as The Raven. We’ve been unable to apprehend The Raven—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Ugh, that is so Raven. [laughter]

speaker: The Director
lines: It is…

speaker: Merle
lines: First blow! Magnus!

speaker: The Director
lines: The first— the first of many, I assume. The Raven is— is named for the black feathered mask that she wears. You w— you will need to apprehend her and retrieve the relic that she has been utilizing to wreak havoc all around Goldcliff. This time I can actually give you some helpful information as to the nature of this Relic.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Sweet. I— is— just out of curiosity, this Raven, is she like evil, chaotic neutral, like is she kind of a Catwoman-esque figure or…?

speaker: Justin
lines: I can’t imagine that people in this universe refer to other people as chaotic neutral. Like, that cannot be in fiction.

speaker: The Director
lines: I’m almost certain that that sort of information— how— how should I say this— should be developed throughout the course of your story—  if your— if— life is like a story, I guess, if you want to think about it like that. The relic she has used to up her criminal game is called the Gaia Sash, which gives the wearer control over nature, it gives them immense control over the powers of wind and thunder and flora—

speaker: Magnus
lines: And heart and fire!

speaker: The Director
lines: Um… And— and what makes this so curious is that The Raven has taken up residence in one of the biggest cities in all the land, and not in the forest where she would be a god. She has been impossible to apprehend, thanks to the powers lent to her by the Gaia Sash. You will need to go to Goldcliff, work with the Goldcliff Militia to bring The Raven in, and secure the sash w— while still acting under the sort of level of discretion we require from you, without too many, uh, too many people catching on what you’re going for.

speaker: Taako
lines: That sounds pretty easy. It sounds better than the train.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Taako
lines: I mean, it’s harder because it’s a whole city… But if we just work at it I’m sure we’ll figure something out.

speaker: Magnus
lines: If we just work together and stay positive!

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, like he said.

speaker: Merle
lines: Guys, we suck. We suck!

speaker: Taako
lines: Speak for yourself, homie, I’m Level 6.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [laughing] I’m chaotic good!

speaker: The Director
lines: I’ve been very impressed with the three of your job performance, but you sound— th— this level of confidence, I’ve never heard this from you three before.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I think it— a lot of it has to do with uh… our yearly review is coming up pretty soon, and we’re all hoping for a pay bump.

speaker: The Director
lines: Oh, I see. It’s like The Secret. You’re— you’re acting confident because you want money. Which is the— that’s the secret, right there.

speaker: Taako
lines: Law of attraction, you know?

speaker: The Director
lines: One st— one step forward, two steps back. We get together… She hates cigarettes and I like to smoke.

speaker: Taako
lines: Okay. Uh, w— let’s go see— do we need any relevant equipment for this or should we just like get moving…?

speaker: The Director
lines: I mean if— that’s up to you, homie.

speaker: Taako
lines: Got any leads?

speaker: The Director
lines: We have a seeker on the ground that you can get more information from, that you’ll need to regroup with. He’s also acting discreetly because his position is fairly high up and he doesn’t want anybody knowing he works for a shadowy… cabal like ourselves.

speaker: Taako
lines: Does he— is he with the militia? Do we have a way to get in  contact with him?

speaker: The Director
lines: I’m sure you’ll figure that out.

speaker: Magnus
lines: How ’bout a name? Can we have a name?

speaker: Taako
lines: Something? You’ve met us, right? Like, you’ve met us? Right?

speaker: The Director
lines: Uh…

speaker: Justin
lines: [In Taako’s voice] On this week’s Adventure Zone, the third one in this series they’re still looking for the guy! Also—

speaker: The Director
lines: He’s the captain of the Goldcliff Militia. His name is— his name is Captain Bane.

speaker: Taako
lines: There we go.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Is “Captain” his first name?

speaker: The Director
lines: Captain Captain Bane, yes, it’s—

speaker: Clint
lines: [Gruff but muffled voice] I’m a captain!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Who was that?

speaker: Clint
lines: That was Bane. Sorry.

speaker: Travis
lines: We’ll work on it later.

speaker: Clint
lines: Why don’t you call him Captain Benny? ’Cause I do a great Jack Benny…

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean, I’m naming it after a real person, so I can’t just change the real person’s—

speaker: Clint
lines: You know a real person named Bane?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. I don’t know him— he’s on Twitter, he listens to the show. Is— are you new?

speaker: Travis
lines: Not anymore!

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s not his name, is it?

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s probably not his Christian name. Listen, uh…

speaker: Taako
lines: We’re gonna get going, okay? Unless you have anything else to impart, any— any uh, any other leads, hot leads…

speaker: Magnus
lines: Any road snacks.

speaker: The Director
lines: Yes—

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, got any road snacks?

speaker: The Director
lines: I’ve brewed you up a phial of gorp, and I think you’re gonna love my special blend. Do you wanna know the secret?

speaker: Merle
lines: Mm… love?

speaker: Taako
lines: Don’t— don’t say raisins.

speaker: The Director
lines: It’s not raisins. Those are a shoe-in for gorp; I think that’s what the “r” in “gorp” stands for. No, my secret… [Griffin —she says—]  come in, lean in close.

speaker: Justin
lines: I lean in close.

speaker: Travis
lines: I lean in far away.

speaker: The Director
lines: [whispering] Pistachios.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —she says.

speaker: Merle
lines: Shelled?

speaker: The Director
lines: Yes, I leave the shells on them. Gives you st— stronger, sturdier teeth. Now get the hell out of my office.

speaker: Travis
lines: You’re a loose cannon!

speaker: Taako
lines: Are you saying to me right now you made gorp-p?

speaker: The Director
lines: I made gor— I actually call it pgorp. [Travis laughing] Please leave. You have stuff to do.

speaker: Clint
lines: Leave your badge and gun.

speaker: Taako
lines: Gporp.

speaker: The Director
lines: [Griffin laughing] You don’t have guns. Please go. Please go, you’re going to lose the trail.

speaker: Taako
lines: Do we need to go see Avi?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you go see Avi at the launchpad. He’s still a little sweaty from— from his workout, he’s wearing uh, he’s wearing a tank top and just get—

speaker: Merle
lines: Hey, did you like it when we kicked your ass down at the omaga-braga-maga-fran?

speaker: Griffin
lines: …The what?

speaker: Taako
lines: The… omega…

speaker: Merle
lines: The omaga-braga-maga-splaga-fran.

speaker: Taako
lines: The omega sphere?

speaker: Griffin
lines: If any one of the three of you can tell me what a 20-sided shape is called, I will mail you a check for 200 dollars.

speaker: Clint
lines: Round.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh… a…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright that’s… Fine.

speaker: Justin
lines: Dodecahedron?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Nope, that’s a 12-sided shape, but thanks for playing.

speaker: Avi
lines: Oh, are you talking about the icosaho— [Griffin fumbles the word]

speaker: Griffin
lines: I— oh, shit, I can’t even do it. Oh shit, I—

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh! Do you know?!

speaker: Avi
lines: Are you talking about the icosagon? Yeah, uh, I don’t think that fight— I think you’re misremembering it. I got in quite a few good blows on you guys— I love you guys though, you—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Listen, we don’t wanna talk about who blew who. We gotta go!

speaker: Avi
lines: Oh, I see what— you’re taking— you turned my words on me. You got me again!

speaker: Taako
lines: It’s classic. Look, can we go?

speaker: Merle
lines: Classic Magnus!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Can we please start an adventure now?

speaker: Avi
lines: Yeah, hop in— hop into the fun ball.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says.

speaker: Taako
lines: Isn’t there some sort of anti-nausea medication that we’ve received before, or am I misremembering that?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay, bye! Launch!

speaker: Griffin
lines: What are you talking— you want some fantasy dramamine? You’re worried I’m gonna ca— inflict—

speaker: Justin
lines: I need a dram of dramamine.

speaker: Clint
lines: It’s dragamine! It’s a dram of dragamine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, here’s a dram of dram— he says

speaker: Avi
lines: Oh yeah, happens to the best of us, buddy, don’t even worry about it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, he says—

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh, you know what, I think I’m thinking about the last time we did this Travis was high.

speaker: Travis
lines: I was drunk, thank you very much.

speaker: Justin
lines: Drunk, okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: He does have his mug, y’know. He could be like Mr. T on The A Team; he can’t fly unless he’s medicated.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Avi pulls a flask out of his jacket and he says

speaker: Avi
lines: Actually, if you guys remember, I keep this on hand for when— when new folks show up, if they are having trouble getting acclimated, give ‘em a li’l nip of hooch… So if you guys want a nip of hooch to help you on the way down, uh, that’s— that’s fine…

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] Oh, we’ve been down this road—

speaker: Avi
lines: But I’m worried— I’m worried if you make it a habit, then it’s a problem…

speaker: Taako
lines: They should come up with a name for that, making a habit out of drinking.

speaker: Avi
lines: So, why don’t you guys hop right in that fun ball and I’ll— I’ll get you going.

speaker: Justin
lines: I do that.

speaker: Magnus
lines: We do that.

speaker: Merle
lines: I do that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m gonna get T-shirts printed that just say “I Do That”. Okay, he shuts the door to the glass cannonball—

speaker: Travis
lines: [providing sound effects, makes a “ka-chunk” noise and breathy exhale]

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughing] …And it depressurizes and you die, I guess?

speaker: Travis
lines: [inhale]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, no, it re— it has repressurized—

speaker: Travis
lines: [exhale]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Now it’s at about half pressure so you’re j—

speaker: Travis
lines: [quickly inhaling and exhaling]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Now the ball is breathing?!

speaker: Travis
lines: [exaggerated, noisy breathing]

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh my god, it’s sentient.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re inside of the living glass ball! No, it’s not living. You— you get inside, it rolls down a chute into the cannon chamber, and you hear the muffled voice of Avi from outside yell

speaker: Avi
lines: Good luck! Uh, have a good t— have a good time down there on the b— in the… world.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And with a start you are fired off! This time in a totally different direction than the direction you went towards Rockport on your last adventure. This time you’re flying east— I think you went west last time. And you’re— you’re flying through the sky. One of you is at the tiller, I’m guessing. The till? What’s it called? The thing. The handle? For flight!

speaker: Clint
lines: The steering mechanism.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The steer— well, it’s more of a brake. You’re not— you’re not really flying this thing, but you can slow its descent by pulling this lever.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m not touching it. Last time I did, we crashed in a swamp.

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s true.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Last time you destroyed some unicorns, if memory serves, and those are endangered. And you were billed, you were fined heavily for that.

speaker: So you’re— you’re flying down for a few minutes before you— you part through the clouds, you pass through the cloud layer, and this trip down is the most scenic one you’ve taken yet, largely in part of the— to the natural beauty of Goldcliff. It’s, as its name suggests, it’s situated on the edge of a cliff, and it’s sort of carved out of this bleak landscape by these two wide crystal blue, crystal clear… Crystal Gayle rivers.
Clint
lines: [singing] Don’t it make my brown water blue.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s icky.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Gross. And, so it— so it’s surrounded by these rivers and they sort of split at the end of the city and surround it, and then just flow freely over the cliff, forming these two large, breathtaking waterfalls. The city itself is largely comprised of these towering buildings that are kind of shimmering in the unrelenting sun in this sort of desert-like area around this oasis. And despite the fact that the— the land outside the rivers is sort of a bleak wasteland, the city itself is kind of lush and green.

speaker: Outside of those rivers it’s sort of just this blasted, featureless land, which sort of makes the city itself look all that more impressive. In that wasteland outside of the city limits of Goldcliff you see something peculiar. You see these long lines of dust clouds, and they’re— they’re just carving a straight path through this bleak scenery, and as you watch them and you get a little bit lower to the ground, you realize they’re actually extending and following a path that is marked by these large pylons — these large black pylons — and as you get even closer you realize that the clouds are being whipped up by wagons that are speeding through the wasteland, and you see some occasional bright flashes of light moving [crosstalk] between the wagons.
Justin
lines: They’re heading towards the city or away?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, towards or away?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Not even heading towards or away from the city. They’re almost circling the city. They’re— they’re pretty far away. It doesn’t look— this is not— nobody’s mounting an assault on— on Goldcliff. You see these lines just sorta racing out in the desert—

speaker: Clint
lines: Is it a race?

speaker: Travis
lines: Good question.

speaker: Griffin
lines: From— with the untrained eye— with your six untrained eyes— eight if you count the goldfish— it kinda looks like it a little bit. But you pass over, uh, you pass over that scene and you are finishing your final descent into Goldcliff.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’ll start pulling the brake.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You pull the brake and your— your descent begins to slow, giving you a closer vantage point of appreciating the city, and you are just gobsmacked by the largest building in town, which is this 20-story tall golden tower with a sort of gaudy golden statue on top of it, holding a wreath emblazoned with the words “Goldcliff Trust”.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is it made out of gold?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s all gold.

speaker: Justin
lines: Is it gold? I love gold.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s— A lot of this stuff is very, very gold. And as you are trying to figure out how much you could hawk a statue of that size for, you— you realize that this building is actually slowly being swallowed up by these gigantic thorny vines that are growing out of the ground at the bottom of the building, and there’s a lot of activity just in front of the building, with like dozens and dozens of— you can make out some— some people and some wagons just sort of surrounding the entrance to the Goldcliff Trust, that’s being enveloped in— in these vines.

speaker: Clint
lines: How high up are they?

speaker: Griffin
lines: They are climbing up, I mean, they are— they are about halfway up the structure at— at this point.

speaker: Travis
lines: Now, Griffin, should we assume that these might be relevant to the story?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No. [small laugh] Okay. So you land, and then you are— you’re— you land, and then you go to Mark’s house [burst of laugh], and you just kick it there for a while, and he’s like, “What do you need? Grand Relic? Gaia Sash? I got that for you right here! See you later, dawgs.” And—

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright, let’s level up!

speaker: Griffin
lines: The end, time to level up. You guys are Level 8 now.

speaker: Justin
lines: Another great adventure!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Your sphere comes, lands with a thud in an alleyway just about a quarter mile away from the Goldcliff Trust, and as you emerge from it and look around, you realize that nobody has really seen— taken any notice of your entrance into the city. And as you exit, the door automatically shuts behind you, a balloon pops out of the top of the ball, and your vehicle floats away.

speaker: Taako
lines: My wallet!

speaker: Merle
lines: I left my Kindle in the seatback!

speaker: Magnus
lines: We all left shit.

speaker: Justin
lines: Dad’s— dad’s third Kindle. Lost another one.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You left your Zune charger in there and now it’s as good as dead. See, that’s a real—

speaker: Clint
lines: You talked me into buying that Zune!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, listen, it was 2006. I said a lot of shit back then.

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughs] Good point.

speaker: Justin
lines: What do we see immediately in front of us?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see— a couple of vagrants. In— they’re in some shabby sorta makeshift dwellings in this alley. There are some kids playing— playing hoop— hoop and stick.

speaker: Justin
lines: Where are we in relation to the trust?

speaker: Griffin

lines: Yeah, like, do we see any— is there— that’s actually not a bad question. Is there— is there like, any sign of money or anything, like, obviously like, stolen or destroyed or anything?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Nothing, like, obviously stolen or destroyed on this floor. But y— again, you only have access to about half of this lobby unless you— you get into those booths in the back of the room.

speaker: Taako
lines: Magnus, you wanna go look at the booths or go through the door?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I mean… let’s check out the booths first.

speaker: Merle
lines: Booths!

speaker: Taako
lines: Merle? Okay, let’s go check out the booths.

speaker: Merle
lines: Booths!

speaker: Taako
lines: We go to the booths.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay! As you walk towards the booths on the back side of the room from where you’re standing, you walk forward and as you begin to approach the fountain in the center of the room, between you and these booths, the tree awakens, and turns toward you, and you can make out some knots and features in this tree, which is not a tree at all my friends, it is a treant! Part tree, part ant! [laughs] Can you even imagine anything more terrifying than a treant? And his name… is Trent. That’s not a listener. I just thought it would be a fun joke. And as it turned out—

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing] You were right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I was right, it’s a really fun—

speaker: Travis
lines: His name is Trent Reznor.

speaker: Griffin
lines: His name is Tre— Nope just Trent. Doesn’t have to be a reference. Just a fun joke I made. It is—

speaker: Justin
lines: Does it look as though he’s rolling for initiative?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, it looks like he’s gonna do a surprise round, because y’all just— just walked right up on him. He is going to rear back— and he’s got one sort of big limb and one sort of small limb with some sharp barbs on it— and he’s gonna go ahead and swing in a pretty wide arc at all three of you with his big limb. Why don’t you make a dexterity saving throw to try and get out of the way of his attack? He rolled a 16.

speaker: Travis
lines: I rolled a four plus two… a six.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, 14 here. No dice.

speaker: Clint
lines: Seventeen.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Seventeen! Okay—

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] Do you have a dexterity bonus, Dad?

speaker: Clint
lines: No, mine’s zero.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Merle, you duck outta the way and shout, “Hey guys look out!” Maybe give a fair warning to your— to your compatriots, who do not acknowledge it. This massive limb smashes directly into Magnus and Taako, and hits you both for…

speaker: Travis
lines: Negative three damage!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Fourteen damage.

speaker: Travis
lines: Whoa.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Picking— and picks you up and slides you back toward the entrance of the room about 30 feet away. And now we’re gonna get into initiative.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: And it says, “Groot!”

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh my God, it’s Groot.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s Groot from the hit movie Groot and His Buds!

speaker: Justin
lines: Fourteen. Fourteen.

speaker: Travis
lines: I got— I got a 12.

speaker: Clint
lines: I have a 14 and a four… so I’ll take the 14.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are you sure? Can I sell you on that four? Wh— yeah you are going right now, Taako.

speaker: Justin
lines: I cast Blink.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You blink and your eyes get moister than they were before, [laughter] and you feel relieved, it had been— you— this— you guys realize, in the whole time we been doing this podcast, you’ve never blinked because you never said you did it. This is crazy.

speaker: Justin
lines: The world is new.

speaker: Travis
lines: I swallow.

speaker: Justin
lines: No, I cast, uh, Blink— that’s one of my new third-level transmutation spells.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: Welcome to the show, Blink! [clapping] So here’s— here’s how Blink works I roll a d20 at the end of each of my turns. And on a roll of 11 or higher, I vanish from this plane of existence and appear in the ethereal plane, uh, and—

speaker: Griffin
lines: What the shit?

speaker: Justin
lines: I know! And at the start of my next turn when the spell ends, I transport back to the— the physical plane within 10 feet of where I was before. And while I’m in the ethereal plane, I can see and hear what’s going on in shades of gray, but I can’t affect anything and nothing can affect me.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [incredulous] So you can— you can fucking Nightcrawl now?!

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, I can bamf.

speaker: Clint
lines: Bamf!

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s radical.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah I know, it’s really cool. I work— I was very proud of that selection.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: So, yes, I cast Blink.

speaker: Travis
lines: I also have that, according to my sheet here. I’ve written it down.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Interesting. [laughter] Everyone— everyone’s blinkin’.

speaker: Justin
lines: My turn is over and I roll… ’kay, 16.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, you blink into the ethereal plane… and— do you disappear from sight from Magnus and— and Ta— and— Merle?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yes.

speaker: Travis
lines: And Magnus loses his goddamn mind.

speaker: Justin
lines: He has no clue what’s happening.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Magnus
lines: What the— huh?!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You blink into the ethereal plane and suddenly your— your vision goes gray. You— you blink out of view from Merle and Magnus. And the scene in front of you, other than the— the color swap change, stays relatively the same, but for a split second, for a flash, after you enter this ethereal plane, you see three gray figures with bright white eyes.

speaker: Travis
lines: What the fuck?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Standing all around the room, sort of positioned around the room, sort of surveying the scene, and as soon as you appear in this ethereal plane, you can see ’em for just a second. Before you can even— can even discern what they are, they blink out of view.

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh man.

speaker: Travis
lines: Nothing weird here!

speaker: Justin
lines: Are they in the physical realm now?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No. Magnus and Merle, you— you see nothing.

speaker: Travis
lines: They just— they just changed the channel they were on. They all switched to 5.1.

speaker: Justin
lines: Not this idiot.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And that’s it for your turn. Next in the order is Merle.

speaker: Clint
lines: I wanna cast Prayer of Healing on Magnus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, okay, yeah, he took a hit.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, he would regain hit points equal to 2d8 plus my spellcasting ability modifier.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Which is, I think, six now?

speaker: Clint
lines: It is.

speaker: Travis
lines: Nice.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Can you— is that a touch spell? Is that a ranged spell? Does it say the range on it?

speaker: Clint
lines: Anyone that I can see—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, you can see him.

speaker: Clint
lines: —within range.

speaker: Travis
lines: Alright, plus seven— oh are you doing it? Yeah, you’re doing it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Merle, you are still standing right next to the fountain with the— with Trent in it. Are you gonna kick it there or are you gonna back up?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah. No. I’m not.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hell yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m not going to. So I roll my eight… so that’s eight, and that’s twice that, correct?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, you roll a second time.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, eight, and… one, so that’s nine, plus six… so I heal him all the way right?

speaker: Justin
lines: Wait, why’s this— wh—how do you figure out the spellcasting modifier again? I’m sorry, this is the one that always— I always forget. These are hit dice by the way.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It is your— your spellcasting modifier is your… so, for clerics I think your wisdom modifier plus your…

speaker: Travis
lines: Proficiency bonus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Your proficiency bonus.

speaker: Clint
lines: Which is three, correct?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right. So—

speaker: Justin
lines: Three plus three…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Three plus three.

speaker: Clint
lines: …Three plus three is six…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Plus your… Actually, plus six, ’cause you have your Extreme Teen Bible, and that’s plus one.

speaker: Clint
lines: So I heal him for 16.

speaker: Travis
lines: But I can’t go above my base number, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, no, no.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m about to—

speaker: Griffin
lines: There’s a mechanic called temporary hit points— I actually don’t know if 5th Edition has temporary hit points, probably—

speaker: Travis
lines: It does.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I would just like to point out, for the first time in this history of this podcast, I think… I actually cast a healing spell.

speaker: Travis
lines: Nice.

speaker: Justin
lines: That was a healing spell, confirmed.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ha-HA!

speaker: Griffin
lines: That was a good one.

speaker: Justin
lines: You had— you had 17 fucking episodes in… but cool.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Next in the order is Magnus.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m gonna run up to the tree, push the button on Railsplitter, and chop it in half.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay you run up to the tree…

speaker: Clint
lines: And you’re welcome, by the way.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yep.

speaker: Justin
lines: That ain’t gonna work. The Tree-ent.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You click the— the button on Railsplitter— it powers up and you rear back and with a mighty swing cut through it like a hot knife… through… water. And… you hear it emit a “Aaaugh!”

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughing] “My butt! You chopped my butt!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: And it topples backwards away from the front door, and topples and falls backwards into the booths in the back of the room which sends up paperwork and receipts, and ledgers go flying up into the air as you fell Trent, the treant, who uses— who uses his two giant, meaty tree branch arms, and he rears himself up and looks square at Magnus in the face— who’s standing in the fountain, looking— looking very proud of himself— he rears up his bark-like face — it’s bark-like because it is bark — and he screams at you very loud, with— with sap pouring out of his mouth.

speaker: Travis
lines: What’s he saying?

speaker: Clint
lines: [watery, garbled noise] “Blfueuehgh!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it’s some— some sorta tree language, which Merle understands, I guess, maybe.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah, I do. I do.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Merle
lines: So let me— let me translate. That means he aggressively is going to retaliate against you and cause you some kind of harm.

speaker: Travis
lines: But… I chopped him in half!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he did take some damage for that.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, I should hope so!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think cutting in half counts as a crit. That’s 16… and then some falling damage…

speaker: Travis
lines: And some halving damage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughs] Extra… Uh, 14 damage… so 30 damage all together.

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s a pretty good hit.

speaker: Travis
lines: I would like— I would just like to point out that if I were fighting a human being and I did an attack that chopped them in half cleanly like, as I believe you said, a hot knife through water, I don’t think we’d be rolling for damage!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well it is a magic tree and not a human so… [laughter]
